meta.name: Toronto Airport Uncovered
meta.description: For the first time, cameras go behind the scenes at Toronto Pearson International, Canada's biggest and busiest airport. They reveal how the airport keeps millions of passengers and thousands of planes moving, even when facing record-breaking snowstorms and extreme winter weather. Technical issues, emergencies, security breaches and passenger demands pile even more pressure on the flight schedule.

videos.title: Battling the Storm
videos.overview: A massive storm hits the airport. Crews race to clear snow and move a jack-knifed Boeing 787 causing chaos at the departure gates.

videos.title: Frozen Frontline
videos.overview: Frozen planes, an injured flight attendant, and a drunk trespasser keep the team on their toes as freezing weather hits the airport.

videos.title: Seconds From Disaster
videos.overview: Fire crews race to a plane with faulty brakes, cargo vanishes, and passengers refuse to check bags.

videos.title: The Crash
videos.overview: A crash landing results in a shutdown that sees flights cancelled and diverted, pushing teams to their limit.
